results.title: Books and people: the wealth within
results.brief_description: States that education is a continuing process which does not end when school studies are completed. The ways in which the modern public library serves this purpose and meets practical needs in the community are illustrated. The film describes how the Alabama library extension agency operates and how it helps local communities in establishing and strengthening county libraries. Various forms of library services designed to meet special needs in the community are described. These include the use of bookmobiles to bring books, recorded music, and films to outlying rural communities.

results.title: Boogie doodle
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film, made without the use of a camera, in which boogie” played by Albert Ammons and synchronized with “doodle drawn by McLaren, frame by frame directly onto film stock, combine to make a rhythmic, colorfully beguiling film experiment. The main title appears in eight languages.

results.title: Bomb threat: plan, don't panic
results.creator_credit: William Brose and William Brose Productions
results.brief_description: Bomb threats, once almost unknown, have dramatically increased in number. The best defence is a plan carefully evolved to fit your organisation. This film is designed for all levels of management and employees. The film is open-ended to promote audience involvement and discussion.

results.title: The Bomb
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Pat Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: A satirical puppet films for children dealing with modern diplomacy. Two opposing embassies, anxious to obtain a nihilistic bomb, emply agents, one being Sebastian the Fox (a puppet). While the diplomats are greedily absorbed with the results they hope to achieve through possession of the bomb, Sebastian removes it. With Bruce Anderson, Lialianne Horschnad, Tom Sanders and Stephen Murray-Smith. Music by George Drefus, puppeteer Janet Van Puffelen.

results.title: The Bolero
results.creator_credit: Allan Miller, William Fertik and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: An exciting study of Ravel’s composition “Bolero” with the subtle meanings and accents polished to a brilliant interpretation by members of the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra with Zubin Mehta. The film involves the viewer in each musician’s approach to his part in individual performance. It also gives some insight into Mehta’s perspective on musical values in the composition. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Blue water challenge
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A stimulating and accurate portrayal of the Golden Fleece Great Circle Yacht Race, which makes a clockwise circumnavigation of Tasmania. Starting off Portsea, Victoria, in January 1980, a fleet of Australia’s leading ocean racing yachts sailon a course of over 800 miles of challenging stretches of water. It has now become the longest race which starts and finishes in Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Blue pullman
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the businessman’s first class express, the new 90 m.p.h. diesel Pullman. Undergoing its preliminary trials between London and Manchester, the features of the train demonstrate themselves with almost no commentary, and the final sequence shows the train in action seen from the air, and from the driver’s cabin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and British Transport Films

results.title: Blossoms revived
results.creator_credit: Krishna Gopal, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Shows what is being done to combat the disease poliomyelitis. The stress is on rehabilitation - teaching the limbs to perform their forgotten functions. Concludes by showing how the skill, devotion and service of a band of workers saved a sick child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Krishna Gopal, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Blood stock
results.creator_credit: Darrel Catling and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: Beginning with all the gaiety of Epsom Downs on a traditional Derby Day, the film traces the career of a prospective Derby candidate, showing the generations of scientific breeding and the years of careful grooming and training which produce winners of this classic race. Shows famous studs, the yearling sales at Newmarket and the stables of well-known trainers.

results.title: Blood is life
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and Great Britain. Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of Britain’s National Blood Transfusion Service. Shows how highly-trained personnel safeguard the health of donors and patients, by scrupulous care of equipment and checking of records. Describes the care with which blood is classified and stored, and how it finally reaches the patient in the operating theatre.
